title: The fact that ADCs are so broken right now is just a buildup of the last few years
body:
http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3551106

Even back then people were sick of how broken ADCs were due to them being required on every damn team composition, and Riot has done almost nothing since then to change that

The ONLY attempt they did to make ADCs optional was the joke that was Mordekaiser's rework, then they left him in the shitter.

replies.body:
Its not about ADCs being required or not. An auto-attack carry is required in pretty much every decent MOBA. 


The problem with league is that _**RANGED**_ ADCs are required. I'd be fine if you had to bring Yasuo bot lane with a support in order for him to be successful, or even Yi. 

Part of the issue is that ranged overcomes any advantage the steroids that melees have will ever bring, and most ranged have steroids on top of that, which is not good for game health, as far as balancing between melee and ranged ADCs. Range IS their steroid. In pretty much any other game, range get utility, not additional steroids. 

Another issue is that any carry that can't make it in lane has to function in the jungle to bypass their early vulnerability when it should be supports with them during laning that should cover that.

The final issue is that most hard carries can function in a solo lane by themselves. Why are Quinn, Graves, Fiora, GP, etc so potent early, mid, and late? Heavy scaling into late game means **crippling** early game weaknesses that force them to take 1 or 2 supports into lane with them in any other game. 

Only very specific champions should be able to jungle because jungle itself should not be a forced 'lane.' 1/1/3 should be a viable strategy as well as 2/1/2, but the EXP mechanics in this game, as well as the per-level scaling are so out-of-whack that several potential strategies are squashed for no good reason.

Jungle should allow specific carries to scale that way (Nocturne, Yi, etc) while the enemy team has to actively seek to shut down their farming. Outside of that, picking a jungler should mean your team wants a gank-heavy strategy to scale into mid-game, which often means not picking super hard carries, that way they can assist better in early-mid ganks. If no jungler is picked, its your mid-laner that should be the ganker. 

Junglers should not be required to have a functional game just like ranged carries should not be absolutely required, and exp cuts with multiple champions need to be addressed to fix this. 

Don't think about mentioning games you've won without ADCs or junglers. We've all won gimmicky games where we snowballed too hard for it to matter if we used the most efficient set-up. There shouldn't **be** a most efficient set-up. All set-ups, barring empty lanes, should be viable, outside of double jungle, simply because it can't function with balanced jungle values. This is a strategy game. Why can't we start acting like it is?

The early game lane swap meta has been popular and effective, and a common variant is the 4/1/0, where both sides give up on the disadvantaged lane and have 2 people pushing a lane, 2 people jungling on the same side, one person mid, and an empty lane. Though not viable as a long-term plan, it is possible to have strategies that, for a decent period of time, leave a lane empty and have 2 junglers.

Junglers should be required because the threat of ganks prevents winning lanes from getting overly aggressive. Otherwise, there's no punishment for continuously forcing the lane into turret, since you can tell when any other laner decides to leave and back off far in advance, wasting the ganker's time. Sure, a comp with a jungler vs. one without might be interesting, but having both teams without junglers just means winning lanes continue to snowball.

ADCs were strong before these shitty season 6 changes.  Riot's too far up their own ass, but at least graves, quinn, vayne, and corki are viable flex picks so you can always have room on your team for lucian or ezreal.

Not to mention the lack of good counter items.  Champ builds crit?  Randuins is trash.  Champ builds attack speed?  Frozen heart got gutted.  Deadman's is great tanky placebo that lets you run in faster to die sooner.

Did somebody say zekes?  50% crit that the adc didn't even have to build.  It's like a 7th item slot on the best class in the game.

The reason melee carries work in dota is because they have active items that actually make a difference in their ability to do things.  You don't cc them because of bkb.  You don't kite them because of turning speed.

Well, fuck it.  Time to start learning to play ADCs everywhere.  Clearly they're not going anywhere, and the sooner riot sees that the diversity in their game is gone, the sooner they'll maybe think about nerfing the all powerful gods that ADCs are supposed to be.

I have played with premade 5's with unique lanes and found some that work far better than 1-1-2+1 jungle with the 2 being adc and support.
Putting a low income safe waveclear champion like Lulu bot lane by herself (have her double jungle at the start) a hard engage top, 2 mid with one being a very strong roaming support and the other a good waveclear or all in champion. Then a diving jungler.

Start top side for the double jungle, getting your bot champ and top laner to help take the camp (if on blue side just smite gromp and go to blue and let top laner have gromp). Make sure the jungler takes the last hit on the big monster from camps and the soloo laner gets the small dudes at blue and red and 1 small wolf. Do a FULL clear with the double jungle making sure the bot laner stays healthy as they are going to need to catch the minion wave and avoid being dove (it should be at your tower, have jungler hang around to make sure they get it if the enemy bot lane is super strong at diving).
Jungle then goes and clears top side jungle again and then roam with the support to top and create pressure or get a kill. Then top/jungle/support all go  get rift herald control.  Hard shove top with all 3 people and dive the enemy laner if he is dumb and stays or tp'd back to lane if you previously killed him with rift herald buff.  Take the tower, proxy the wave or whatever (the solo bot laner very likely should retreat into your jungle and just take camps to avoid being counter dove). Then flip everyone on their head to pressure mid or bot while the low income player goes top to play in the much safer long lane. Your mid should have a farm advantage on the enemy mid from it being 2v1 to start, even if slightly down on xp. So they should be hitting item breakpoints and be able to roam bot to create a 4 vs 2/3 play with a tp on your low income player that is top, just in case.

every single time me and my friends ran this strat we absolutely dominated the current meta. no one could handle it and usually got flamed in all chat for cheesing them.  Sadly it is hard to keep all 5 of us on for much at a time or climbing would be cake.

Most important bans: Blitzcrank (Makes a 1v2 lane impossibly dangerous because a hook = death), Poppy (depends on your jungler, but she is so hard to dive sometimes), Rek'Sai (because she can easily track and counter your plays)

Fave comp we did it with:
{{champion:59}} top/high income laner: enabled diving and was able to bully a little early to to make it even easier
{{champion:60}} jungle: Imo the best diving jungler right now
{{champion:42}} mid: scales hard off gold and levels, early level disadvantage didnt really matter because was able to pick up items on time. Also package is super powerful and enables tower taking
{{champion:1}} the roaming support: easy to charge stun, and corki + annie was able to kill the enemy mid actually a couple times. Also ranged so works great for tower taking too
{{champion:117}} bot/low income solo laner: really safe, able to clear waves and not die.

Once you get outer towers down, just group and roam to pressure and take towers, have corki and lulu pickup side waves to keep wave control. Annie+J4+Corki made for some insanely strong teamfights. 
Annie + Elise is a lot of pick potential if you catch someone while roaming.

Seriously give this a try if you have 4 other people willing to play it with you. Or add me and I can play the Hard roam support (Thresh, Annie, Alistar are my fave to use for it)  And if you dont want Corki cause he is a "marksman" there are other champs like {{champion:157}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:99}} {{champion:31}} that you can easily swap in his place for mid lane. Corki is just rather ideal for it.

Their actually role isn't required for the teamcomp itself. If it were, we would have seen an ADC in another lane when bot lane Mord was a thing. (Which didn't happen when he was pick/ban in the LCS.) 

ADC's are the optimal choice in the Duo lane, because their damage is Auto attack focused. Meaning they scale more from items than from levels. Making them Okay, when an XP leach is right next to them. (But I don't hear anyone complaining about the support meta do I?) 

The only way you could work around that fact is if you some how got rid of the support. (then you would need to survive the 1v2.) Or cheat the xp system. (Which is what Mord did, and was considered toxic for it.) 

The only other option would be to work a champion so that he's simply better in the Duo lane. Possibly as a result of ally dependent spells. (again, like they did with Mord.)
